channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: Hamas Says Ready To Start Gaza Ceasefire Talks "Immediately"

media:content.media:description: The conflict in Gaza began with Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel on October 7, 2023.

item.description: Hamas said Friday it was ready to start talks "immediately" on a proposal for a ceasefire with Israel in Gaza, after holding consultations with other Palestinian factions.
item.content:encoded: Hamas said Friday it was ready to start talks "immediately" on a proposal for a ceasefire with Israel in Gaza, after holding consultations with other Palestinian factions.

item.title: Trump Signs Flagship "Big Beautiful Bill" Into Law

media:content.media:description: Trump signed his flagship "Big Beautiful Bill" into law at a ceremony at the White House on Friday.

item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump signed into law a massive package of tax and spending cuts at the White House on Friday, staging an outdoor ceremony on the Fourth of July holiday that took on the air of a Trump political rally.
item.content:encoded: U.S. President Donald Trump signed into law a massive package of tax and spending cuts at the White House on Friday, staging an outdoor ceremony on the Fourth of July holiday that took on the air of a Trump political rally.

item.title: Hamas Says It Is Consulting With Palestinian Factions Over Gaza Ceasefire

media:content.media:description: The conflict in Gaza began with Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel on October 7, 2023.

item.description: Hamas said Friday it was holding consultations with other Palestinian factions on a proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza, where the civil defence agency said Israel's ongoing offensive killed more than 50 people.
item.content:encoded: Hamas said Friday it was holding consultations with other Palestinian factions on a proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza, where the civil defence agency said Israel's ongoing offensive killed more than 50 people.

item.title: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: PM Addresses Trinidad & Tobago Parliament

media:content.media:description: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: After Trinidad & Tobago, PM Modi will travel to Argentina

item.description: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a five-nation tour - Ghana, Trinidad & Tobago, Argentina, Brazil and Namibia.
item.content:encoded: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a five-nation tour - Ghana, Trinidad & Tobago, Argentina, Brazil and Namibia.

item.title: Search On For Survivors Of Pakistan Building Collapse
item.description: A five-storey building collapsed in Pakistan, killing at least eight people and injuring nine others, officials said, with rescuers searching through the rubble for more trapped victims.
item.content:encoded: A five-storey building collapsed in Pakistan, killing at least eight people and injuring nine others, officials said, with rescuers searching through the rubble for more trapped victims.

item.title: Nutella Fans Brace to Pay More As Frost Hits Turkish Hazelnut Harvest
item.description: A fresh supply squeeze is set to hit another food pleasure - the hazelnuts that go into making the chocolaty Nutella spread.
item.content:encoded: A fresh supply squeeze is set to hit another food pleasure - the hazelnuts that go into making the chocolaty Nutella spread.

item.title: PM Modi Conferred With Trinidad And Tobago's Highest Civilian Honour

media:content.media:description: PM Modi was conferred with 'The Order of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago'

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Friday conferred with 'The Order of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago' - the country's highest civilian honour.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Friday conferred with 'The Order of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago' - the country's highest civilian honour.

item.title: Video: Escaped Pet Lion Attacks Woman And Children On Pakistan Street

media:content.media:description: The lion, an 11-month-old male, has been confiscated by police.

item.description: An escaped pet lion chased a woman and two children down a busy street in Pakistan's Lahore, police said, with dramatic footage showing the big cat leaping a wall before pouncing on them.

item.title: Exclusive - Biology Beyond Earth: How Space Station Is Shaping Human Life in Space

media:content.media:description: NASA astronaut Suni Williams works on the Plant Water Management at the space station.

item.description: Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is visiting a home away from Earth that has seen continuous human presence for a quarter of a century and is floating around 400 kilometres above Earth.
item.content:encoded: Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is visiting a home away from Earth that has seen continuous human presence for a quarter of a century and is floating around 400 kilometres above Earth.

item.title: Starmer Reveals How "Good Relationship" With Trump Helped Him Secure A Deal

media:content.media:description: Keir Starmer has said that he has found common ground with Donald Trump

item.description: Keir Starmer, the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom has said that despite "different political backgrounds" he has found common ground with the President of the United States, Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded: Keir Starmer, the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom has said that despite "different political backgrounds" he has found common ground with the President of the United States, Donald Trump.

item.title: 'Pak Doesn't Know Where Masood Azhar Is, May Be In Afghanistan': Bilawal Bhutto's Stunner

media:content.media:description: Mr Bhutto is the head of the Pakistan People's Party.

item.description: Pakistani politician Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has, in a stunning claim, said Islamabad does not know where Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Masood Azhar is, adding that the country would be "happy to" arrest him if India gives information.
item.content:encoded: Pakistani politician Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has, in a stunning claim, said Islamabad does not know where Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Masood Azhar is, adding that the country would be "happy to" arrest him if India gives information.

item.title: Stabbing Suspect In Finland Has Violent Criminal History: Police

media:content.media:description: The incident was being investigated as "four attempted manslaughters" by the police.

item.description: Finnish police said Friday that the 23-year-old man suspected of stabbing four people near a shopping centre in Finland had a history of violent crimes.
item.content:encoded: Finnish police said Friday that the 23-year-old man suspected of stabbing four people near a shopping centre in Finland had a history of violent crimes.

item.title: At WTO, India Proposes Retaliatory Duties Against US Aver Auto Tariffs

media:content.media:description: India has notified the WTO's Council for Trade in Goods of its proposed suspension of concessions.

item.description: India on Friday proposed imposing retaliatory duties under the WTO (World Trade Organisation) norms against the US over American tariffs imports on the country's auto parts in the name of safeguard measures.
item.content:encoded: India on Friday proposed imposing retaliatory duties under the WTO (World Trade Organisation) norms against the US over American tariffs imports on the country's auto parts in the name of safeguard measures.

item.title: How Enslaved Americans Responded To July 4 Declaration Of Independence

media:content.media:description: As Douglass spoke that day in 1852, slavery was still legal in half the country.

item.description: The summer air in Rochester, New York, hung thick with heat and celebration. It was July 5, 1852, a day after cannons had fired, flags waved and towns across America had burst into patriotic jubilation
item.content:encoded: The summer air in Rochester, New York, hung thick with heat and celebration. It was July 5, 1852, a day after cannons had fired, flags waved and towns across America had burst into patriotic jubilation

item.title: Swiss Glaciers Hit Annual Tipping Point Weeks Early

media:content.media:description: "It's like the glaciers are shouting out: 'We're disappearing. Help us.'"

item.description: The snow and ice accumulated last winter by Switzerland's glaciers has already melted away, a monitoring service said, with Friday marking the alarming second-earliest arrival on record of the tipping point known as glacier loss day.
item.content:encoded: The snow and ice accumulated last winter by Switzerland's glaciers has already melted away, a monitoring service said, with Friday marking the alarming second-earliest arrival on record of the tipping point known as glacier loss day.

item.title: Nuclear Inspectors Have Left Iran: UN Watchdog
item.description: UN nuclear watchdog inspectors left Iran, according to the agency, which called for the resumption of its "indispensable monitoring" after the Islamic republic officially suspended its cooperation.
item.content:encoded: UN nuclear watchdog inspectors left Iran, according to the agency, which called for the resumption of its "indispensable monitoring" after the Islamic republic officially suspended its cooperation.

item.title: The Fireworks Origin: Why America Lights Up The Sky On 4th Of July

media:content.media:description: People across the US celebrate this day with parades, concerts and dazzling displays of fireworks.

item.description: Every year on July 4, skies across the US light up with fireworks to mark the Independence Day.The US gained independence in 1776 after the 13 colonies declared their separation from British rule by adopting the Declaration of Independence.
item.content:encoded: Every year on July 4, skies across the US light up with fireworks to mark the Independence Day.The US gained independence in 1776 after the 13 colonies declared their separation from British rule by adopting the Declaration of Independence.

item.title: Microsoft Shuts Pakistan Operations After 25 Years, Cites Global Restructuring

media:content.media:description: The move came as the tech giant cut roughly 9,100 jobs worldwide.

item.description: Tech giant Microsoft has announced to shut down its limited operations in Pakistan as part of its global strategy to reduce workforce, which various stakeholders termed on Friday as a "troubling sign" for the country's economy.
item.content:encoded: Tech giant Microsoft has announced to shut down its limited operations in Pakistan as part of its global strategy to reduce workforce, which various stakeholders termed on Friday as a "troubling sign" for the country's economy.

item.title: Dozens Hurt In Fuel Station Blast Heard Across Rome
item.description: A huge explosion at a petrol station in a Rome suburb injured nearly 30 people, two of them seriously, and rattled windows across the Italian capital.
item.content:encoded: A huge explosion at a petrol station in a Rome suburb injured nearly 30 people, two of them seriously, and rattled windows across the Italian capital.

item.title: Czech Republic Hit By Major Power Outage
item.description: A major power outage that hit parts of the Czech Republic, briefly halting underground trains in the capital Prague, was probably the result of a technical outage, with no signs of a cyber or terrorist attack, authorities said.
item.content:encoded: A major power outage that hit parts of the Czech Republic, briefly halting underground trains in the capital Prague, was probably the result of a technical outage, with no signs of a cyber or terrorist attack, authorities said.
